overview:
Moritz Loew is the SVP of MSNBC Interactive and an investor and advisor at Anttenna, a mobile application that facilitates real-time, location-based, person-to-person exchanges. Moritz, a digital media veteran, provides strategic insights to Anttenna, leveraging his diverse background in monetizing media across new platforms

Before becoming SVP of MSNBC Interactive, Moritz rose through various Sales positions at MSNBC, including Eastern Region Sales Manager and Senior Director of Sales (2004-2007). Prior to his time at MSNBC, Moritz was a MSN Solutions Manager at Microsoft (1999-2004).

Moritz holds a Bachelors of Science from Arizona State University in Marketing.
